alert.note: Alert for Ashland; Knox; Richland (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 5:51PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Richland, south central Ashland and eastern Knox Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 551 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Gambier, or near Mount Vernon, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mount Vernon, Fredericktown, Gambier, Bellville, Danville, Butler, Gann and North Liberty. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
